2.2 Two- Player Multi- Memory Repeated GameWe further consider two- player
- memory repeated games as an iteration of the two- player normal- form game (see illustration Fig. 1- A). The players are assumed to memorize their actions in the last
rounds. Since each player can take

We now analyze the Nash equilibrium in multi- memory repeated games based on the formulation of Markov games. Let us assume that every agent uses a fixed strategy

or learns slowly enough for the timescale of the Markov transitions. If we further assume that the strategies are within the interiors of simplexes (i.e., the Markov matrix is ergodic), this stationary distribution is unique and described as
. We also denote each player's expected payoff in the stationary distribution as
. The goal of learning in the multi- memory game is to search for the Nash equilibrium, denoted by
